Create a Histogram Plot with Logging and Validation

Source: R/figure_create_histogram_plot.R
create_histogram_plot.Rd

This function generates a histogram plot with optional faceting and includes the total sample size in the plot title. It logs all inputs, outputs, data transformations, and file paths to the console.

Usage

create_histogram_plot(
  df,
  x_var,
  facet_var,
  binwidth = 1,
  title = "",
  x_label = "",
  y_label = "Count",
  output_file = NULL
)

Arguments

df

A data frame containing the data to be plotted. The data should include the columns specified by x_var and facet_var.

x_var

A string specifying the name of the variable to plot on the x-axis.

facet_var

A string specifying the name of the variable for faceting. Each unique value in this variable creates a separate facet.

binwidth

A numeric value specifying the width of the histogram bins. Default is 1.

title

A string specifying the title of the plot. The total sample size will be appended automatically to this title.

x_label

A string specifying the label for the x-axis. Default is an empty string.

y_label

A string specifying the label for the y-axis. Default is "Count".

output_file

Optional. A string specifying the file path to save the plot as an image. If NULL, the plot is not saved. Default is NULL.

Value

A ggplot object representing the histogram. The plot is also saved to the specified output_file if provided.
